newsitem.title: UK: London clean tankers steady, up in Caribbean.
newsitem.headline: London clean tankers steady, up in Caribbean.

text.p: Clean tanker rates were steady along most major routes this week but higher levels were posted in the Caribbean and for naphtha voyages in Europe.

Eastbound Mideast rates for larger 55,000-tonne vessels finished the week stable at W165/W167.5 but were under threat from a number of oil-bulk ore carriers arriving in the area, said brokers E A Gibson.
Smaller Mideast vessels carrying 27,000-30,000 tonnes for India were pegged in the low W180s. Mediterranean naphtha carriers saw active trade and ended the week at W170-172 for 27,500 tonnes.
But an oversupply of tonnage kept Med gas oil vessel rates lower.
Caribbean clean rates showed a significant rise on the week, taking 30,000 tonners to W240-245 for upcoast U.S. trades.
Handy inter-UK/Cont rates were little moved with fixtures below W200 for 22,000 tonne inter-European sailings.
